      • expectContinue

        public RequestBuilder expectContinue​(boolean enable)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Requests the server to acknowledge the request before sending the body. This is disabled by default. If enabled, the server is requested to send an error response or a 100 Continue response before the client sends the request body. This means the request publisher for the request will not be invoked until this interim response is received.

        Description was taken from Java documents.
        Specified by:
        expectContinue in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
        Parameters:
        enable - true if Expect continue to be sent
        Returns:
        instance of T

      • version

        public RequestBuilder version​(java.net.http.HttpClient.Version version)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Sets the preferred HttpClient.Version for this request.

        The corresponding HttpResponse should be checked for the version that was actually used. If the version is not set in a request, then the version requested will be that of the sending HttpClient.

        Description was taken from Java documents.
        Specified by:
        version in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
        Parameters:
        version - the HTTP protocol version requested
        Returns:
        instance of T

      • header

        public RequestBuilder header​(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String... values)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Adds the given name value pair to the set of headers for this request. The given value is added to the list of values for that name.

        Description was taken from Java documents.
        Specified by:
        header in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        values - the header values
        Returns:
        instance of T
        See Also:
        RFC 7230 section-3.2

      • timeout

        public RequestBuilder timeout​(java.time.Duration duration)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Sets a timeout for this request. If the response is not received within the specified timeout then an HttpTimeoutException is thrown from HttpClient::send or HttpClient::sendAsync completes exceptionally with an HttpTimeoutException. The effect of not setting a timeout is the same as setting an infinite Duration, ie. block forever.

        Description was taken from Java documents.
        Specified by:
        timeout in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
        Parameters:
        duration - the timeout duration
        Returns:
        instance of T

      • queryParam

        public RequestBuilder queryParam​(java.lang.String name,
                                 FormValueDelimiters delimiter,
                                 boolean allowReserved,
                                 java.lang.Object... values)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Appends query parameter. Appends query parameter. It gets value of the parameter joined into one string, where given values are separated by delimiter.
        Specified by:
        queryParam in interface RequestSettings<RequestBuilder>
        Parameters:
        name - parameter name
        delimiter - is a delimiter/separator of values.
        allowReserved - means to percent-encode reserved characters or not. It keeps these characters not encoded when given value is true
        values - array of values of the the parameter. The method is designed to accept primitive values, objects of primitive wrappers, strings, arrays and collections of mentioned types. Any value may contain non ASCII characters.
        Returns:
        instance of T

      • queryParam

        public RequestBuilder queryParam​(java.lang.String name,
                                 boolean allowReserved,
                                 java.lang.Object... values)
        Description copied from interface: RequestSettings
        Appends query parameter. It explodes multiple value of the parameter by default.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        name - parameter name
        allowReserved - means to percent-encode reserved characters or not. It keeps these characters not encoded when given value is true
        values - array of values of the the parameter. The method is designed to accept primitive values, objects of primitive wrappers, strings, arrays and collections of mentioned types. Any value may contain non ASCII characters.
        Returns:
        instance of T
